lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
Jim is a desktop app for managing tasks, optimized for use via a Command Line Interface (CLI).
If you can type fast, Jim can get your task management done faster than traditional GUI apps.
Words in UPPER_CASE are the parameters to be supplied by the user.
e.g. in `todo TASK_DESCRIPTION`, `TASK_DESCRIPTION` is a parameter which can be used as `todo read book`
Adds a todo task into your list.
How can I help you: todo homework
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Adds a deadline task into your list.
How can I help you: deadline assignment /by tuesday night
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Adds an event task into your list.
How can I help you: event cca/at 6pm-8pm
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Lists all the tasks in your list.
How can I help you: list
Marks a task, based on its index, as done.
* Marks the task at the specified `TASK_INDEX` as done.
* The index refers to the index number shown in the displayed task list.
* The index must be a positive integer 1, 2, 3, ...
* The task should not be done already
How can I help you: done 1
Nice! You're a real champ for finishing this:
Removes a task, based on its index.
* Removes the task at the specified `TASK_INDEX`.
* The index refers to the index number shown in the displayed task list.
* The index must be a positive integer 1, 2, 3, ...
How can I help you: remove 1
This task has been spirited away:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list!
Find tasks that contains the keyword from the list.
* The search is case-insensitive. e.g. `read book` will match `READ BOOK`
* Task description containing the keyword will be returned
e.g. `read` will return `read book` and `read magazine`
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Displays the available commands and the input format for them.
Duke saves your task list from the usage into your local storage as a text file.
Upon reinitialization, it reloads that file, so you access previously added tasks
* Changes the input attribute to the one given by the user.
* @param input The input by the user.
* Adds a deadline task into the task list and updates the database accordingly.
* If there is no input after the command word, the user will be prompted to include one in the correct format.
* If there is no /by in the input, the user will be prompted to include it in the correct place.
* If there is no description or deadline given, the user will be prompted to include it.
* @param tasks task list to be updated when a deadline task is added.

* If there is no description or time range given, the user will be prompted to include it.
* @param tasks task list to be updated when an event task is added.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

* @param tasks task list to be used in overridden commands.
* @param ui Ui access in overridden commands.
* @param storage Storage access in overridden commands.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage);

* @param storage storage access that is included so exit command can extend command.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Changes the input attribute to the one given by the user.
* @param input The input by the user.
* Shows the tasks that can be found using the user's input to the user. If there are no such tasks,
* the user will be shown a text message to reflect that.
* If there is no input after the command word, the user will be prompted to include it.
* @param tasks Task list to be used to find the tasks.
* @param storage storage access to allow find to extend command.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* @param tasks task list that is included so help command can be extended from command.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

* @param tasks task list to be accessed.
* @param storage storage access that allows list to extend command.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Changes the input attribute to the one given by the user.
* @param input The input by the user.
* Marks a task as done and updates that task in both the task list and database file.
* If there is no input after the command word, the user will be prompted to include it.
* If the input after the command word is not an integer number, the user will be prompted
* If the task does not exist, the user will be shown an error message that informs them of that.
* If the task is already marked as done, the user will be shown an error message that informs them of that.
* @param tasks task list to be updated when a task is marked as done.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Changes the input attribute to the one given by the user.
* @param input The input by the user.
* Removes a task from the task list and updates the database file accordingly.
* If there is no input after the command word, the user will be prompted to include it.
* If the input after the command word is not an integer number, the user will be prompted
* If the task does not exist, the user will be shown an error message that informs them of that.
* @param tasks task list to be updated when a task is removed.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Shows welcome message. Takes in user command and executes that command (if possible, shows error if not)
* Taking and executing user command will loop until isExit is true, where the function terminates.
* Parses the user input and returns the command that is being called.
* @return Command being called to be executed.
* @throws JimException If input does not call any command.
public static Command parseCommand(String input) throws JimException {
* Checks if the folder for the database exists. Creates one if it does not.
* Checks if the database file exists. Creates one if it does not.
* @param file The file path for the database.
* Initialises the task list using the data from the database file.
* @throws JimException If file line is corrupted with other data.
public void initList(Scanner s) throws JimException {
* Initialises the storage component of Jim.
* Appends a task to the database.
* @param type The type of task to append ("T" for todo, "D" for deadline, "E" for event)
* @param input The description of the task.
* @param isDone The boolean that checks if the task has been completed.
public static void appendDatabase(String type, String input, String isDone) {

* Returns 'X' if the task is done and ' ' otherwise as the done status.

* Returns the task information in String format.
protected static final String VERSION = " Chatbot Jim - Version 7" + System.lineSeparator();
protected static final String GREETING_MESSAGE = " HeLLO! I'm Jim, a real person who definitely passes" +
protected static final String USER_INPUT_MESSAGE = " How can I help you: ";
protected static final String WRONG_COMMAND_FORMAT_MESSAGE = " Wrong command format! Please refer to the help " +
protected static final String BIRTHDAY_MESSAGE = " ^o^ Happy birthday to you! ^o^" + System.lineSeparator();
protected static final String CLEAR_DATABASE_MESSAGE = " Database wiped clean!" + System.lineSeparator();
protected static final String NO_DATABASE_FILE_MESSAGE = " No database file!" + System.lineSeparator();
protected static final String CORRUPTED_DATABASE_FILE_MESSAGE = " File is corrupted at Line ";
protected static final String CHECK_FOLDER_MESSAGE = " Checking for database folder..." + System.lineSeparator();
protected static final String CREATE_MISSING_FOLDER_MESSAGE = " Folder not present...creating new folder!" +
protected static final String FOLDER_FOUND_MESSAGE =  " Folder located!" + System.lineSeparator();
protected static final String CHECK_DATABASE_FILE_MESSAGE = " Checking for database..." + System.lineSeparator();
protected static final String CREATE_MISSING_DATABASE_FILE_MESSAGE = " Database not present...creating new database!"
protected static final String DATABASE_FILE_FOUND_MESSAGE =  " Database located!" + System.lineSeparator();
protected static final String EMPTY_LIST_MESSAGE = " This list is empty and sad :(" + System.lineSeparator();
protected static final String LIST_MESSAGE = " Here is your task list:" + System.lineSeparator();
protected static final String ADD_MESSAGE = " Got it. I've added this task:"  + System.lineSeparator() + "   ";
protected static final String ADD_ERROR_MESSAGE = " Error while adding task!"
protected static final String MISSING_TASK_DESCRIPTION_MESSAGE = " Please add a task description!"
protected static final String MISSING_TASK_DEADLINE_MESSAGE = " Please add a task deadline!"
protected static final String MISSING_EVENT_TIME_RANGE_MESSAGE = " Please add an event time range!"
protected static final String MISSING_TASK_OR_DEADLINE_MESSAGE = " Please format your input as 'deadline [task]" +
protected static final String MISSING_TASK_OR_TIME_RANGE_MESSAGE = " Please format your input as 'event [task]" +
protected static final String MISSING_BY_MESSAGE = " Please add '/by' in between your task and deadline!" +
protected static final String MISSING_AT_MESSAGE = " Please add '/at' in between your task and time range!" +
protected static final String INVALID_COMMAND_MESSAGE = " I don't quite understand :/" + System.lineSeparator();
protected static final String NOTHING_TO_REMOVE_MESSAGE = " Please identify something to remove!" +
protected static final String DELETE_TASK_MESSAGE = " This task has been spirited away:" + System.lineSeparator();
protected static final String NO_SUCH_TASK_MESSAGE = " No such task! You're not THAT productive..." +
protected static final String REMOVE_COMMAND_ERROR_MESSAGE = " Please input an integer after remove!" +
protected static final String TASK_ALREADY_DONE_MESSAGE = " This task was already marked done!" + System.lineSeparator();
protected static final String NO_TASK_SPECIFIED_MESSAGE = " Please specify the task you would like to " +
protected static final String DONE_COMMAND_ERROR_MESSAGE = " Please input an integer after done!" +
protected static final String TASK_COMPLETE_MESSAGE = " Nice! You're a real champ for finishing this: " +
protected static final String NO_KEYWORD_SPECIFIED_MESSAGE = " Please specify the keyword you would like to " +
protected static final String FOUND_TASK_MESSAGE = " Here are the matching tasks in your list: " +
protected static final String TASK_NOT_FOUND_MESSAGE = " No task with given keyword in description!" +
protected static final String HELP_MESSAGE = " Here are the commands for the things I can do:" +
"    1. todo [task] = adds a Todo task" + System.lineSeparator() +
"    2. deadline [task] /by [deadline] = adds a Deadline task" + System.lineSeparator() +
"    3. event [task] /at [time range] = adds an Event task" + System.lineSeparator() +
"    4. done [taskIndex] = marks the desired task as done" + System.lineSeparator() +
"    5. remove [taskIndex] = removes the desired task" + System.lineSeparator() +
"    6. list = lists out all tasks you have currently" + System.lineSeparator() +
"    7. find [keyword] = finds all tasks that contain the keyword in the description" + System.lineSeparator() +
"    8. clear = wipes your database spick and span" + System.lineSeparator() +
"    9. help = shows the list of things I can do for you ^^ (aka this list)" + System.lineSeparator() +
protected static final String EXIT_MESSAGE = " Bye! Remember, stay out of fire, suuuuuuper high level " +
